elements.title: State Publishing House of Ukraine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 1920s belles-lettres books published by the State Publishing House of Ukraine (symbol pictured) sold out more rapidly than similar books published elsewhere in the Soviet Union, despite the higher average price?

elements.title: Juan de Casas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Juan de Casas, the Spanish military governor of Venezuela, cried after the French demanded that he accept a Frenchman as king?

elements.title: a girl group (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Empire of Japan created a girl group as propaganda?

elements.title: Justiniano Borgoño (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a bust of former Peruvian president Justiniano Borgoño was stolen from its pedestal by thieves?

elements.title: Republic Drug Store (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Republic Drug Store was formed from the consolidation of an estate and its competition?

elements.title: a coconut tree meme (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a coconut tree meme drove sales of piña coladas in the Washington, D.C., area?

elements.title: Nicole Chang-Leng (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nicole Chang-Leng has been described as a "daughter" of the Seychelles?

elements.title: a former teacher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a former teacher in the Philippines became a Robin Hood–like outlaw?

elements.title: Sugar Dog Life (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the author of Sugar Dog Life ended up buying and raising a cactus after drawing one in the manga?
